summary: The video features Emer Costello, Member of the European Parliament, as she discusses various aspects of the Fund for European Aid to the Most Deprived (FEAD). The narrative covers the fund's purpose, differences from previous programs, European Parliament's perspective, negotiation challenges, and the fund's role in addressing food waste.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen, followed by a title card that reads "What is the Fund for European Aid to the Most Deprived?" in white and orange text on a dark background. The logo and website "the environment NE\SIUS your digital ecosystem iiea.com" are visible in the bottom right corner. The scene transitions to a woman with short, light brown hair and glasses, wearing a white blazer and a pearl necklace, speaking directly to the camera against a dark background. The logo and website remain visible throughout her speech. The video maintains a consistent focus on the woman as she continues to speak, with no significant changes in her appearance or the background. The atmosphere is professional and informative, with the woman delivering a message related to the Fund for European Aid to the Most Deprived.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a drum beat of a simple rock style. An adult female speaks calmly and explains that a new EU fund will provide food and aid to "the most vulnerable". She emphasizes how many people are at risk for poverty, suffering from "extreme material deprivation", and are homeless, saying the fund is an expression of the EU's solidarity. The clip ends with the rock drum beat heard at the beginning.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a dark background featuring a text slide that reads, "How is it different from the previous fund?" in white and orange letters, accompanied by the logo and website of the International Institute for Environment and Development (IIED) in the bottom right corner. The scene then transitions to a woman with short, light brown hair, wearing glasses and a white blazer with a pearl necklace, speaking directly to the camera against a dark background. The IIED logo and website remain visible in the bottom right corner throughout her speech. The woman appears to be addressing the audience, likely discussing the differences between the current fund and the previous one, as suggested by the initial text slide. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere, focusing on the woman's presentation and the IIED's branding.
events_list.audio_caption: A woman is speaking in an informative tone about a new food fund that is replacing a program from the agriculture budget. She explains that intervention stocks are low, and a court case questioned the legal basis of the old fund. She emphasizes that the new fund, "Feed," differs in several ways, primarily by coming from the social cohesion budget. The fund now covers not just food aid but also basic consumer goods, which is welcomed by NGOs. Finally, the fund is open to citizens in every European country, prioritizing people who are deprived over governments and member states, encouraging participation from all.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a title screen displaying the text "What is the European Parliament's view of the fund?" in white and orange letters against a dark background. The logo and website "the environment NEXIUS your digital ecosystem liea.com" are visible in the bottom right corner. The scene transitions to a woman with short, light brown hair and glasses, wearing a white blazer and a pearl necklace, speaking directly to the camera against a dark background. Throughout the video, the woman maintains a professional demeanor, with her expressions and mouth movements indicating she is delivering a speech or presentation. The consistent background and attire suggest a formal setting, likely related to the topic introduced in the title screen. The video maintains a steady focus on the woman, emphasizing her role as the primary speaker.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single female speaker with a professional, informative tone, discussing a program related to the European Parliament. She mentions that members of the parliament "stated categorically" that a budget of 2.5 billion is insufficient and supported a recommendation to increase the fund to 3.5 billion euro. She then explains that "519 deputies" supported the fund and the call for an increased budget and adds that the next step involves negotiations with the Council and Commission. No music or background sounds are present.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with short, light brown hair and glasses, wearing a white blouse and a pearl necklace, speaking directly to the camera against a dark background. The logo of "the environment NEXUS" and the website "iiea.com" are visible in the bottom right corner throughout the video. The woman appears to be discussing a topic related to environmental negotiations, as indicated by the text "What happens next in the negotiations?" displayed on a dark background in the middle of the video. The text is in white and orange, with "next" highlighted in orange, emphasizing the focus on the future steps in the negotiations. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere, with the woman's expressions and gestures suggesting she is providing insights or analysis on the subject matter.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio starts with a female speaker discussing a "blocking minority" at a council opposed to a fund and the lack of support for a budget increase. The speaker has a serious tone, and then the audio transitions to another female speaker discussing difficult negotiations, budget concerns, and a minority trying to block the fund from existing. The speaker has a concerned tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with short, light brown hair and glasses, wearing a white blazer and a pearl necklace. She appears to be speaking directly to the camera against a dark background. Throughout the video, the woman maintains a professional demeanor, with her facial expressions and mouth movements indicating that she is engaged in delivering a message or presentation. The text "the environment NE·SI·US your digital ecosystem" and "iiea.com" is visible in the bottom right corner of the screen, suggesting that the video is related to environmental topics and digital ecosystems, and is likely produced by the Institute of International and European Affairs (IIEA). The overall atmosphere of the video is formal and informative, with the woman's attire and the consistent background emphasizing the professional nature of the content.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker discussing a bloc of minority nations, mentioning countries like Germany and the UK. She notes their disagreement with the EU providing food aid to people in poverty, speaking in an informative tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with short, light brown hair and glasses, wearing a white blazer and a pearl necklace, speaking directly to the camera against a dark background. Throughout the video, her facial expressions and mouth movements indicate that she is engaged in delivering a speech or presentation. The text "the environment NEISIUS your dental ecosystem" and "liea.com" appears in the bottom right corner of the screen, suggesting that the content is related to environmental or dental topics and is associated with the website liea.com. The woman's attire and the professional setting imply that the video is likely part of a formal presentation or interview. The video maintains a consistent visual style, with no significant changes in the background or the woman's appearance, emphasizing the continuity of her speech.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with someone talking about the European Parliament and the FEAD, describing it as the only way the European Union reaches vulnerable citizens across member states. The speaker stresses poverty's lack of boundaries and the fund's importance in reaching people in need. The speaker then makes another statement about reaching people. The clip features one speaker, who is female.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with short, light brown hair and glasses, wearing a white blazer and a pearl necklace, speaking directly to the camera against a dark background. The logo "the environment NE·SI·US your digital ecosystem" and the website "iiea.com" are visible in the bottom right corner throughout the video. The woman appears to be discussing a topic related to environmental issues, as indicated by the text that appears in the video. The text reads, "How does the fund address the problem of food waste?" in white and orange letters, suggesting that the video is part of an informational or educational series about environmental concerns and solutions. The video maintains a professional and informative tone, with the woman's expressions and gestures emphasizing her points as she speaks.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker in a professional, assertive tone discussing needing to persuade a "blocking minority" to lift objections and convince the council and commission that "2.5 billion" is insufficient given increased participation and broader scope. Underneath the speech, there is very faint, neutral background music.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen displaying the text "How does the fund address the problem of food waste?" in white and orange letters, accompanied by the logo and website of "the environment NE·SI·US" in the bottom right corner. The scene transitions to a woman with short, light brown hair and glasses, wearing a white blouse and a pearl necklace, speaking directly to the camera against a dark background. The logo and website remain visible throughout her speech. The woman appears to be discussing the topic introduced in the opening text, providing insights or explanations related to the fund's approach to addressing food waste. The video maintains a consistent visual style, focusing on the woman's expressions and gestures as she communicates her message.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a single speaker, a woman, discussing issues with a proposal. Her tone is thoughtful and deliberate as she mentions concerns about "food aid," "food waste," "local supply chains," and "healthy living." She describes how they proposed amendments to synergize with EU policies, promoting healthy eating and local supply chains. Background music is subtle and unobtrusive, sounding like generic elevator music.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with short, light brown hair and glasses, wearing a white blouse and a pearl necklace. She appears to be speaking directly to the camera against a dark background. Throughout the video, her facial expressions and mouth movements suggest she is engaged in a conversation or delivering a message. The text "the environment NE SIUS your digital ecosystem liesa.com" is visible in the bottom right corner of the screen, indicating a possible connection to an environmental or digital ecosystem company. The woman's demeanor remains professional and focused, with no significant changes in her appearance or the background throughout the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single female speaker with a measured tone, discussing organizations in Ireland that provide food banks and work to reduce food waste. She mentions these organizations collaborating with retail supermarket chains to prevent the destruction of good food. She expresses hope that a specific fund will encourage other agencies and provide them with seed capital. This speech is accompanied by the gentle background sound of speech, creating an ambient atmosphere.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with short, light brown hair and glasses, wearing a white blouse and a pearl necklace, speaking directly to the camera against a dark background. The text "the environment NEXUS your digital ecosystem liea.com" appears in the bottom right corner, indicating the video's association with the Environment Nexus project. The woman's expressions and mouth movements suggest she is delivering a speech or presentation. The video transitions to a dark screen displaying the Environment Nexus logo and the text "your digital ecosystem," followed by a message stating that the content is part of the Environment Nexus project, funded by DG Communication of the European Parliament. The video concludes with a white screen featuring the text "The content is a contribution by the European Commission DG Communication, Streaming Media, www.liea.com," indicating the source and purpose of the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip consists of a single speaker, who appears to be female, explaining how the predictability of a fund will help leverage additional assistance. She mentions the fund will provide food aid, which may include oddly shaped potatoes. This aid will be channeled through organizations that are distributing food and other materials. Ambient sounds are present in the background.
